titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Allen Sigel Collection of Scores, 1946-1998
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Gabrielle Carlo and John Bewley, September 2012.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded in EAD by John Bewley, September 2012.

did.head: Collection Overview
did.langmaterial: Collection materials include texts in English.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library

did.abstract: The Allen Sigel Collection of Scores, 1946-1998 contains approximately 27 compositions by Allen Sigel. Many of them are present in multiple versions. There are also ten works by other composers in arrangements by Sigel and three of his didactic works for clarinet.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Specified item], Allen Sigel Collection of Scores, 1946-1998, Music Library, The State University of New York at Buffalo.

accessrestrict.head: Terms of Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials can be examined by qualified researchers in the Music Library during hours of operation during which Music Librarians are present. In order to insure access, researchers are advised to contact the Music Library in advance of visits.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright for the materials in the collection does not reside with the Music Library. Therefore, patrons wishing to publish any item, or part of an item from this collection for any purpose, are responsible for securing requisite permissions.

accruals.head: Accruals and Additions
accruals.p: No further accruals are expected to this collection.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Allen Sigel was born 9 February 1925 in Chicago, Illinois. He spent his youth in Ottumwa, Iowa and began his studies in clarinet at the age of eleven. He earned his bachelor's degree at the University of Iowa where he studied clarinet with Hymie Voxman and earned a master's degree in 1947 at the Eastman School of Music in Rochester, New York.

Allen Sigel served as principal clarinetist with the Buffalo Philharmonic Orchestra 1948-1960 (with the exception of the 1950-1951 season) and served on the music faculty at the University at Buffalo beginning in 1953. In 1960 he joined the faculty full time and served until 1992. He also taught in other positions in Iowa, Kentucky, and California. He wrote three books on clarinet instruction, including The Twentieth Century Clarinetist. In 1986 Sigel traveled to China to lecture and perform. He served as music director for the Jewish Center of Buffalo and was an instructor in the Elder Hostel program where he taught a course, Composers of the golden age of American musical theatre.
Allen Sigel died in Williamsville, New York 15 March 2013.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection contains 102 folders holding approximately 27 compositions by Allen Sigel, ten works by other composers in arrangements by Sigel, and three of his didactic works for clarinet. Many of the compositions exist in multiple versions and some were reworked altogether and renamed. For example, the melody to his Patriots all, which he submitted as an entry in a competition to select a new national anthem for the United States, is the same as that of his U.B., our University , a candidate to become the alma mater for the University at Buffalo.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in three series:

item.ref: II. Arrangements of works by other composers

arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by first element of the uniform title. Movements within works are filed in order as presented in the work.

physdesc.extent: 3 manuscript scores (76 p. ; 28 cm)and 5 manuscript parts

note.p: Arranged for flute, piccolo; oboe, English horn; clarinet, French horn, and bassoon.
Includes 3 holograph (photocopy) scores with minor differences and a complete set of 5 holograph (photocopy) parts.

unittitle.title: Bartokiana
Bartokiana for violin, B? clarinet, and piano,

physdesc.extent: 4 manuscript scores (9 pages; 28 cm) and 2 manuscript parts

note.p: Accompanied with a letter addressed to Allen Sigel from Nancy Braithwaite expressing interest in obtaining a copy of Bartokiana.
Contains 1 holograph (pencil) score and 1 ink score, 1 incomplete holograph (ink) score, 1 spiral-bound photocopied score, holograph (ink) violin part, and photocopy of clarinet part.

unittitle.title: Casual developments
Casual developments for clarinet and string quartet,

physdesc.extent: 1 manuscript score (15 p.) and 8 manuscript parts

note.p: Dedicated to Ken Grant.

Includes 1 holograph (photocopy) score of the 3rd movement, 4 photocopied parts of the 1st movement, and 4 manuscript (ink) parts for the 3rd movement. A tacet is indicated for the 2nd movement for all instruments.

unittitle.title: Dorothy Parker On men
Dorothy Parker on men: poems of Dorothy Parker set to music,

physdesc.extent: 1 manuscript score (9 p.) and 2 manuscript parts

note.p: Holograph (ink)
For soprano, oboe, bassoon, and piano.
Accompanied by photocopy of typescript letter form Sigel to Andrew D. Weinberger seeking permission to use Parker's poems.
Includes 1 holograph (ink) score with markings of 2 poems, and 2 manuscript (ink) parts of 2 poems.

unittitle.title: Eppes klezmer
Eppes klezmer for B?clarinet and piano,

physdesc.extent: 3 manuscript scores (14 pages; 28 cm) and 1 manuscript part

note.p: Related to Shtetl echoes, composed in 1995.

Includes 1 holograph (ink) score with corrections, 1 photocopy with additional markings for the piano part, 1 pencil score, and 1 manuscript (ink)part for clarinet with markings and another photocopy without markings.

Consists of 1 manuscript (pencil and ink) score with corrections, 2 holograph (photocopy) scores (1 spiral-bound), 9 manuscript (pencil) parts and an additional set of photocopied parts with further markings.

unittitle.title: Flapper era dances
Flapper era dances for saxophone quartet,

physdesc.extent: 2 manuscript scores (27p.), manuscript sketches, and 4 manuscript parts

note.p: Arranged for soprano, alto, tenor, and baritone saxophone.
Accompanied with a letter containing information about the premiere of flapper era dances, which took place on Monday, October 10 1994.
Also contains tempo and articulation instructions for each part.

Contains 1 holograph (pencil) score of all 4 movements with corrections and 1 spiral-bound holograph (photocopy) score, 4 photocopied parts and a separate folder containing manuscript (pencil) sketches of all 4 movements.

unittitle.title: Flapper era dances
Flapper era dances for clarinet and string quartet,

physdesc.extent: 1 manuscript score (10, 15, 15 p.) and 5 manuscript parts

note.p: Arranged for B?clarinet, violin I and 2, viola, and violoncello.
Charleston is marked movement 3 on manuscript parts and movement 4 on the score.
Contains 1 manuscript (pencil) score of all 3 movements, 1 photocopy of the 3rd movement with additional markings, and 5 manuscript (pencil) parts.

unittitle.title: Four nations suite
Four nations suite for piano, four hands,

physdesc.extent: 3 manuscript scores (12 p.) and manuscript sketches

note.p: Includes 1 spiral-bound holograph (pencil) score with list of corrections, 2 spiral-bound holograph (photocopy) scores with additional markings, and manuscript sketches: variation of the 1st movement, sketch of movements 3 and 4.

scopecontent.p: Contents: France-homage to Francis Poulenc--Spain-homage to Manuel De Falla--Israel-homage to Ernest Block--Hungary-homage to BÃ©la BartÃ³k.

unittitle.title: Four nations suite
Four nations suite for piano and saxophone quartet,

note.p: Arranged for piano, soprano, alto, tenor, and baritone saxophone.

Consists of 1 manuscript (ink) score of all 4 movements, 1 manuscript (pencil) score of all 4 movements, 1 photocopy of movement 4 with markings for clarinet and violin, and 4 manuscript parts of all 4 movements.

scopecontent.p: Contents: France-homage to Francis Poulenc--Spain-homage to Manuel De Falla--Israel-homage to Ernest Block--Hungary-homage to BÃ©la BartÃ³k.

unittitle.title: From then 'till now
From then 'till now: suite for oboe or soprano saxophone and strings,

note.p: Accompanied with an analysis of all 4 movements.
The baroque concerto is based on Johann Sebastian Bach's keyboard concerto in C minor BWV 981--an arrangement of Benedetto Marcello's op. 1 no.2.
Includes 1 spiral bound manuscript (ink) score of all 4 movements.

scopecontent.p: Contents: Baroque concerto--Classical rondo--Romantic serenade--Twentieth century scherzo.

unittitle.title: Garland for Gershwin
Garland for Gershwin: for C clarinet and piano,

note.p: Includes 1 holograph (ink) score with corrections, and 2 holographs (photocopy) with additional markings.

unittitle.title: Homage to Gershwin

physdesc.extent: 3 manuscript scores and manuscript sketches (10 p.)

note.p: Includes 1 holograph (ink) score of all 3 movements, 2 photocopies of the 3rd movement of the holograph score with additional markings, and 10 pages of manuscript sketches for the 3rd and 1st movements.

unittitle.title: Homage to Gershwin

note.p: Accompanied by a cover sheet that dedicates the piece to Tom Ridenour.
Contains 1 holograph (ink) part for B? clarinet for the 1st and 3rd movements, 1 photocopy of the 2nd movement, and 1 manuscript (pencil) cadenza that proceeds the 2nd movement.

unittitle.title: Homage to Gershwin
Homage to Gershwin: for B? clarinet and piano,

note.p: Includes 13 pages of manuscript (pencil) sketches for the 3rd movement.
Includes 1 holograph (pencil) score, 1 manuscript (ink) score with corrections, and 1 holograph (photocopy) with further markings.

unittitle.title: Homage to Gershwin
Homage to Gershwin: for saxophone quartet,

note.p: Arranged for soprano, alto, tenor, and baritone saxophone.
Accompanied with a description of the piece.
Dedicated to the Amherst Saxophone Quartet.
Includes 1 holograph (ink) score of all 3 movements, 2 holograph (photocopy) scores of the 3rd movement with differences, and 10 pages of manuscript sketches.

unittitle.title: Homage to Gershwin
Homage to Gershwin: for saxophone quartet,

note.p: Arranged for soprano, alto, tenor, and baritone saxophone.
Includes 4 holograph (photocopy) parts of all 3 movements, and 1 holograph (photocopy) of the 1st movement part for alto saxophone.

unittitle.title: Homage to Gershwin
Homage to Gershwin: for woodwind quintet,

physdesc.extent: 2 manuscript scores (10 p.) and 5 manuscript parts

note.p: Arranged for flute, oboe, B? clarinet, French horn, and bassoon.
Contains 1 manuscript (pencil) score, 1 incomplete manuscript (pencil) score, and 5 manuscript (pencil) parts.

unittitle.title: Homage to Prokofiev
Homage to Prokofiev for B? clarinet and piano,

note.p: Includes 2 holograph (photocopy), 1 trimmed and taped to create performance copy for pianist. The performance copy contains additional markings including an optional cut. 1 manuscript copy (ink) with photocopy containing additional manuscript replacement pages. 1 manuscript (ink) part for B? clarinet and 3 photocopies with different markings.

unittitle.title: In Gershwin's garden
In Gershwin's garden: trio for clarinet, violoncello, and piano,

physdesc.extent: 3 manuscript scores (24 p.) and 2 manuscript parts

note.p: Includes 1 holograph (pencil) score of both movements, 2 holograph (photocopy) scores, and 2 manuscript (ink) parts.

physdesc.extent: 2 manuscript scores (32 p.) and 4 manuscript parts

note.p: Accompanied with program notes.
Includes Hatikva score.

Includes 1 spiral bound photocopy of holograph score with additional markings; 1 photocopy of the holograph score (not bound) with other markings; ink manuscript parts for violin I and II, viola, and violoncello, heavily marked with bowings. Also included are additional unmarked photocopies of the violin II, viola, and violoncello.

unittitle.title: Poe potpurri
[Poe potpurri [sic] for narrator, trumpet, and saxophone quartet],

note.p: Accompanied with 4 photocopied leaves of Poe texts marked in preparation for use.

Holograph (Ink) score. The score is in two groups. The pages in the first group run p. 1-23 in one direction and then p. 24-39 return in the opposite direction on the verses, so the verse of p. 23 is p.24, the verse of p. 22 is p. 25 and so on. The second group is paged in normal fashion as p. 40-55

scopecontent.p: Contents: The haunted palace--A dream within a dream--The masque of the red death.

Title from card attached to cover.

unittitle.title: Poe potpurri, clarinets (4)
Alone; The haunted palace; A dream within a dream: for clarinet quartet,

note.p: Holograph (Ink)
The haunted palace and A dream within a dream movements are versions of the same movements in Sigel's Poe potpurri for narrator, trumpet, and saxophone quartet.
Each part contains 3 fascicles with separate title pages corresponding to the 3 movements.

scopecontent.p: Contents: Alone--The haunted palace--A dream within a dream.

unittitle.title: Poe potpurri, saxophone, strings. Selections.
A dream within a dream; Moving,

note.p: An oboe can be substituted for the soprano saxophone part.
Holograph: Dream within a dream is an ink holograph; Moving is a photocopy of a holograph with additional changes. The movements are marked III and IV respectively.

unittitle.title: Poe potpurri, voice and piano
Alone; The haunted palace; A dream within a dream: for voice and piano,

note.p: Holograph (Ink and pencil)
Words by Edgar Allan Poe.
First line of text for Alone: From childhood's hour I have not been as others were; I have not seen as others saw; I could not bring my passions from a common spring.
First line of text for The haunted palace: In the greenest of our valleys by good angels tenanted, once a fair and stately palace-radiant palace- reared its head.
First line of text for A dream within a dream: Take this kiss upon the brow, and in parting from you now, this much let me avow-you are not wrong who deem that my days have been a dream.

Includes an additional photocopy of The haunted palace. The haunted palace and A dream within a dream are versions of the movements with same titles in Sigel's Poe potpurri for narrator, trumpet, and saxophone quartet.

scopecontent.p: Contents: Alone--The haunted palace--A dream within a dream.

Alone; A dream within a dream,

note.p: Holograph (Pencil)
Words by Edgar Allan Poe.
A dream within a dream is a different version of the movement with the same title in Sigel's Poe potpurri for narrator, trumpet, and saxophone quartet.

did.unittitle: Sigel, Allen U.B., our university: Alma mater, 1991

note.p: Holograph (Ink)
For unaccompanied four-voice chorus (soprano, alto, tenor, bass).
Words by Allen Sigel. First line of text: Learning's clear light shines radiant and bright.
Accompanied by printed lyrics (1 leaf) bearing the title U. B., our university.

unittitle.title: U. B., our university
Alma mater, State University of New York at Buffalo,

note.p: Computer-notated score for chorus (soprano, alto, tenor, bass) and piano accompaniment.
Words by Allen Sigel. First line of text: Learning's clear light shines radiant and bright.
Scores numbered 1-4; number 4 has the title U. B., our university; number 3 has the first line of text from Sigel's work, Patriots all.

unittitle.title: U. B., our university
Alma mater, State University of New York at Buffalo,

note.p: Computer-notated score for unaccompanied 4-voice chorus.
Words by Allen Sigel. First line of text: Learning's clear light shines radiant and bright.
Accompanied by the printed lyrics (1 leaf) bearing the title U. B., our university. The two scores differ in formatting and contain minor variations in lyrics.
Holograph (Ink) and computer-notated.
Single melody line with text. Words by Allen Sigel. First line of text: Learning's clear light shines radiant and bright, in this noble university.
Holograph (Photocopy)
The work is for chorus and band; this score is only for band.
Words (not included here) by Allen Sigel.

did.unittitle: Arrangements of works by other composers, 1972-1991

unittitle.title: Quartets, piano, strings, no. 1, op. 25, G minor. Rondo alla zingarese; arr.
Quartet for piano, oboe, clarinet, and violoncello, op. 25. Rondo alla zingarese,

note.p: The score is a pencil holograph. The piano and violoncello lines in the score are photocopies from a printed score taped onto the holograph. The clarinet part is an ink holograph; the oboe part is a photocopy of a holograph, the violoncello part is a photocopy of a printed part with some changes on manuscript paper taped onto the part. Also includes photocopy of a printed violin part.

Arranged for woodwind quintet.

Arranged for woodwind quintet by Allen Sigel.
There are duplicate manuscript parts for the flute in Caravan, and flute and clarinet in Sophisticated lady.

scopecontent.p: Contents: Caravan--Sophisticated lady--Take the A train.

unittitle.title: Fugues, organ, HMV 609, A minor; arr.
Fugue number 5 in A minor for soprano voice, clarinet, and piano,

physdesc.extent: 1 manuscript score (7 p.) and 2 manuscript parts

note.p: Holograph (Pencil)
Originally for organ; arranged by Allen Sigel. The voice part was remarked to be for oboe.

Variations on a theme of Gluck, K. 455,

note.p: Computer-notated score.
Originally for piano; arranged for clarinet and piano by Allen Sigel. Part marked for performance by Sigel.
Published 1986 by Shall-u-mo Publications, Rochester, New York.
Pencil holograph score and ink holograph parts.
Songs arranged by Allen Sigel for violin, clarinet, and piano.
The pencil holograph score includes attached photocopied pages; the pages of the photocopy of the score are numbered 1-33. Accompanied by photocopy of the original version of I love you.

scopecontent.p: Contents: It's de-lovely--So in love--My heart belongs to daddy--I love you--You're the top.

note.p: Contains manuscript list of recorded Porter songs, 22 leaves of printed Porter lyrics, and photocopies of Porter songs: Always true to you in my fashion, In the still of the night, Just one of those things.

Originally for piano; arranged for clarinet and piano.

physdesc.extent: 1 manuscript score (6 p.) and 5 manuscript parts

note.p: Holograph (Pencil)
Arranged for woodwind quintet.
Published by Roncorp, Inc., Cherry Hill, New Jersey. Musical studies with accompanying text.

unittitle.title: Clarinet masterwork etudes: mastering the masterworks,

note.p: Photocopy of typescript and musical studies based on eleven masterworks of the repertoire for clarinet.
Title on cover: Clarinet master class.
Combination of mimeographed typescript text and musical etudes written in ink on vellum masters.
Spiral-bound volume with 14 preliminary pages of mimeographed text and charts, 49 pages of ozalid reproductions of musical etudes, and 12 pages of mimeographed text following the etudes.
